metadata.title: CVE-2018-12126 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Microarchitectural Store Buffer Data Sampling (MSBDS): Store buffers onsome microprocessors utilizing speculative execution may allow anauthenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via a sidechannel with local access. A list of impacted products can be found here:https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/corporate-information/SA00233-microcode-update-guidance_05132019.pdf

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20190514.0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-148.174
linux-image-4.4.0-148-lowlatency - 4.4.0-148.174

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20190514.0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-148.174').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.117').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1113.118').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1083.93').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-50.54~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1045.49').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1032.34~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1046.52').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1039.41~16.04.1').

libvirt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.1-1ubuntu10.26').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
